intro: Helianthopsis jelskii, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has adaptations such as succulent leaves to conserve water. Its bright yellow flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh environments.
